intro: Triumfetta fazoglensis, commonly known as the Sudanese false mallow, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its hairy stems and lobed leaves. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, often during the rainy season. It is adapted to drought conditions and can thrive in poor soil, making it a resilient species in its native habitat. Triumfetta fazoglensis is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional medicine.
